sentences.chinese: 合情飾貌者，禮樂之事也。
sentences.literal: Uniting emotions and adorning appearances is the matter of ritual and music.
If ritual and righteousness are established, then noble and base are equalized;
If music's patterns are unified, then superiors and inferiors are harmonious;
If likes and dislikes are manifest, then worthy and unworthy are distinguished;

sentences.chinese: 刑禁暴，爵舉賢，則政均矣。
sentences.literal: Punishment restrains violence, rank raises the worthy, then governance is even.

sentences.chinese: 仁以愛之，義以正之，如此則民治行矣。
sentences.literal: Benevolence loves them, righteousness corrects them; thus then popular governance proceeds.
Music emerges from within, ritual is made from without.
Music emerges from within, therefore tranquil;
Ritual is made from without, therefore patterned.
Great music must be easy, great ritual must be simple.

sentences.chinese: 樂至則無怨，禮至則不爭。
sentences.literal: When music arrives then no resentment, when ritual arrives then no contention.

sentences.chinese: 揖讓而治天下者，禮樂之謂也。
sentences.literal: Yielding and deferring to govern the world is what ritual and music are called.

sentences.chinese: 暴民不作，諸侯賓服，兵革不試，五刑不用，百姓無患，天子不怒，如此則樂達矣。
sentences.literal: Violent people do not arise, feudal lords submit as guests, weapons are not tested, five punishments are not used, the people have no troubles, the Son of Heaven is not angry; thus then music is achieved.

sentences.chinese: 合父子之親，明長幼之序，以敬四海之內。
sentences.literal: Unite father-son intimacy, clarify elder-younger sequence, to respect within the four seas.
If the Son of Heaven is thus, then ritual proceeds.
